tasks.task: Measuring and Observing Sunflower Maturity and Structure
subtasks: Measure the height of a sunflower from the ground to the middle of the head.
Remove the sunflower head upon maturity, using appropriate tools when necessary.
Assess the maturity of the sunflower seeds by checking seed color and seed pattern clarity.
Count the number of green brackets (leaf structures) around the back of the head, though not applicable in this case.
Measure and record the height of the sunflower after removing the head.
Observe and count the number of spirals formed by the seeds on the sunflower head.
When the sunflower head is mature, count the spirals in both clockwise and counterclockwise directions.
Verify the counts using a visual inspection or digital tools (e.g., photos and computer software).
Analyze the counts to check if they follow Fibonacci sequence numbers, which often occur in plant structures. Here, the spiral counts (34 and 21) are Fibonacci numbers.
